Answer: Two glaring differences stand out - well, at least two.First, training and organisation.The US military has no conscripts. Its service personnel are motivated to be there as volunteer professionals. They know that promotion depends on learning and improving, so they learn and improve. There is a large and stable NCO cadre to preserve, develop and pass on that training and know-how.Russia conscripts troops. They don’t want to be there and they don’t like it. The NCO cadre is relatively small and dedicated to imposing discipline upon the unwilling. They don’t want to teach, nobody wants to learnTwo glaring differences stand out - well, at least two.First, training and organisation.The US military has no conscripts. Its service personnel are motivated to be there as volunteer professionals. They know that promotion depends on learning and improving, so they learn and improve. There is a large and stable NCO cadre to preserve, develop and pass on that training and know-how.Russia conscripts troops. They don’t want to be there and they don’t like it. The NCO cadre is relatively small and dedicated to imposing discipline upon the unwilling. They don’t want to teach, nobody wants to learn from them.Second, equipment and logistics.And when I say ‘equipment’ I do not mean the wunderwaffe that get the headlines, like the Poseidon “All your Cotswolds is belong to fish!’ torpedo. I mean dull, boring, mundane stuff that the hoplophiles don’t get stirred up about. I mean spare oil filters for diesel engines, and first-ad kits, and field rations, and waterproof boots.A US general who sent troops into the field with the kind of kit, supplied by the kind of logistics, that Russia has shown in Ukraine would be standing outside the Pentagon, with all his belongings in a cardboard box, in about eight seconds flat.In short, it’s about informed motivation and ingrained professionalism. You’ll find both in abundance in the armed forces of most of the major Western powers. In Russia’s, the evidence for their existence is at best limited.

Answer: There is a close relationship between China and Israel. China is one of a few countries that has a good relationship with both Israel and the Arab countries.There are several projects in Israel that China is working on. For example, a Chinese company, SIPG, is building a major port in Haifa and will control it for 25 years.Two companies based in China’s Shandong province announced in July 2017 the recruitment of 6,000 Chinese steel fixers, carpenters, tilers and plasterers to be sent to Israel to work on construction projects. Later that year, Israeli and Chinese officials signed a $300 millioThere is a close relationship between China and Israel. China is one of a few countries that has a good relationship with both Israel and the Arab countries.There are several projects in Israel that China is working on. For example, a Chinese company, SIPG, is building a major port in Haifa and will control it for 25 years.Two companies based in China’s Shandong province announced in July 2017 the recruitment of 6,000 Chinese steel fixers, carpenters, tilers and plasterers to be sent to Israel to work on construction projects. Later that year, Israeli and Chinese officials signed a $300 million trade agreement in Beijing, which will increase the Israeli exports of environmentally-friendly agricultural and energy technologies to China.Chinese technology companies are increasing their investments in Israel. In 2018, more than 50 Chinese companies participated in financing Israeli technology companies.Israeli genealogy and genetic testing company MyHeritage announced in March 2020 that it would collaborate with China’s BGI Genomics to set up a coronavirus testing lab in Israel.Unfortunately, the US is applying extreme pressure on Israel to stop collaborating with China. Pompeo had warned Israel that further Israeli economic linkage with China "will hurt relations with the US.”So Israel must now make some tough decisions.

Answer: The primary reason that Russia is a declining power is due to ubiquitous corruption from top to bottom. So much of its wealth is siphoned off by greedy, cynical people who only think of themselves and accumulating as much money, power and property as possible. Russia has always had a problem with corruption but now the amounts of money are greater than ever before.Even in Soviet times, the Party elites depended on propaganda and lies to keep the Russian people on board regardless of living conditions in Russia. Everything Russian made was substandard. I worked there in the 80s and saw, first hThe primary reason that Russia is a declining power is due to ubiquitous corruption from top to bottom. So much of its wealth is siphoned off by greedy, cynical people who only think of themselves and accumulating as much money, power and property as possible. Russia has always had a problem with corruption but now the amounts of money are greater than ever before.Even in Soviet times, the Party elites depended on propaganda and lies to keep the Russian people on board regardless of living conditions in Russia. Everything Russian made was substandard. I worked there in the 80s and saw, first hand, how life was. Russia was a 3rd world country pretending to be a modern 1st world country.While there are now more modern buildings in Moscow and a few more middle class people, most of Russia is still 3rd world. The Russian elites still use propaganda and misinformation to convince the Russian people that their lives are just as good or better than people in Western Europe or North America.By attacking Ukraine Vladimir Putin has, unwittingly, exposed Russian weakness. Now the entire world sees what Russia actually is rather than what the Russian government wants to project. Even Russia’s huge international propaganda machine is losing its credibility with most people.Eventually, after Putin and his oligarch clans are gone, Russia will recover. The Russian people are resilient, strong, creative and hard working. But Russians will need to transform their country into a real modern, 1st world country. That will take a great deal of work and courage and time. Corruption will need to be cut back significantly so that most of the money earned in Russia goes to benefit the Russian people and Russia itself rather than a few corrupt, greedy elites.Until then, the Russian people will suffer due to Vladimir Putin, his elite supporters and good people who just sit and watch their country going down the toilet of history.

Answer: That depends on whether you mean technology in general, or Technology as a formal degree area.Technology as an area is effectively including everything that isn't within the liberal arts, math, and the social sciences.  Anything that is involved with the analysis and synthesis of artifacts is technology.  Thus, a general answer to your question is "All the colleges specializing in engineering and applied sciences."There are some colleges that focus on use of technology as a major.  That is, rather than focus on the underlying science to analyze phenomena, or the engineering disciplines to makeThat depends on whether you mean technology in general, or Technology as a formal degree area.Technology as an area is effectively including everything that isn't within the liberal arts, math, and the social sciences.  Anything that is involved with the analysis and synthesis of artifacts is technology.  Thus, a general answer to your question is "All the colleges specializing in engineering and applied sciences."There are some colleges that focus on use of technology as a major.  That is, rather than focus on the underlying science to analyze phenomena, or the engineering disciplines to make artifacts, they focus on the wide variety of applications of existing artifacts.   Community colleges and many for-profit trade schools effectively teach technology in this fashion, although they may not award degrees in that field.  Many baccalaureate programs exist, either in name or spirit, and they can often be found at polytechnics.Purdue has one such set of programs.  Ours was founded over 50 years ago as a complement to the engineering and science schools here.  It was named the College of Technology for a long time, and recently renamed as the Purdue Polytechnic Institute.  They award 4-year BS degrees in several areas of applied technology, including EET (electrical engineering technology), CIT (computer and information technology), and CGT (computer graphics technology).  The Purdue programs all tend to be highly ranked, and the job placement for graduates is outstanding.(For illustration, if you wanted to learn about the fundamentals of computation, including limits of computation, design of data structures, algorithms, and protocols, you would come to Purdue for the Computer Science degree, in the College of Science.  If you wanted to learn about building computer systems, including issues of component design, circuit structure, signal strengths, memory architectures, and embedding processors, you would come to get a degree in Electrical & Computer Engineering in our College of Engineering.  But if you wanted a degree in building and configuring enterprise networks, applied computer forensics,  business automation tools, and telecommunication design, then that would be Computer Information Technology in the Purdue Polytechnic Institute.)

Without technology a human female is quite likely to die giving birth as is the child. The systems of genetic mingling is plagued with infections that can make organisms infertile and/or kill them and the dimwitted idea of sharing openings in the body for both waste removal and reproduction means (yet more) infections and damage to the female giving birth.Plants aren’t any better.A huge % of their effort is in wasted reproductive efforts, billions of tonnes of seeds and pollen are spewed all over the planet with only a tiny % actually growing into a new plant. Such is the incompetence of the hypothetical “designer” that primitve humans whose technology was at the stage of “isn’t stone a cool new material ?” were able to get farm plants to reproduce massively more efficiently.Feel free to imagine a designer, just don’t hire him.

name: Steve Baker
question: https://www.quora.com/What-advantages-does-Israel-have-over-Russia-These-include-advantages-in-economy-wealth-distribution-military-living-standards-leadership-level-of-advancement-technological-achievements-current-and-historical-contributions-to-the-world-etc

Answer: The rate of evolution slows when environmental stressors are stable. If the situation is one where “unfavorable genes survive and reproduce” the relation between the gene pool and the environment would be unstable and the rate of evolutionary change would increase not ‘slow down’.

Answer: We are nowhere near it.Nowhere. Not even slightly.An exoskeleton that allows the user to have greater strength for lifting in specific circumstances? Yes. But not a suit. A suit that allows you to breathe? Sure, with GIANT tanks attached to it, for a couple hours.Let’s break down what the suit is and why we can’t have nice things… yet. (and I’m not even going to use the new nano particle suit, just the one from Iron Man I - the very first movie, the basic suit).Fully enclosed suit:We are nowhere near it.Nowhere. Not even slightly.An exoskeleton that allows the user to have greater strength for lifting in specific circumstances? Yes. But not a suit. A suit that allows you to breathe? Sure, with GIANT tanks attached to it, for a couple hours.Let’s break down what the suit is and why we can’t have nice things… yet. (and I’m not even going to use the new nano particle suit, just the one from Iron Man I - the very first movie, the basic suit).Fully enclosed suit:Self contained:Tiny Power Source:Inertia Dampening:Recycling:Strength actuators:Mind Interface:The suit is slow, and easily overcome by attackers if you manipulate it any other way thanRepulsorsAIExotic materials:Actual Holographic displays:As you see any ONE of these inventions would revolutionize its industry and change our lives for the better, but you need ALL of them to replicate his suit. You need the actuators to give it the stretch but the suit would fall apart from stress so you need the exotic materials but then you need to power it so you need a power source that generates enough power in a tiny space that doesn’t kill the wearer with radiation and heat, but you can’t fly unless you have repulsors and then you can’t control it because you don’t have the mind interface, but then you are limited in what you can do unless you have the most advanced and complete and benign AI installed but you can’t do that unless you have the computing power that is insanely powerful in a tiny space and none of that matters because a couple hits from physical attacks would turn your body and brain to jelly from the outside shocks so you need electronic inertial dampeners that would put the Enterprise to shame.And that’s why we can’t have nice things.PS - I’m sure I missed something. :)

name: Howard Galt
question: https://www.quora.com/What-advantages-does-Israel-have-over-Russia-These-include-advantages-in-economy-wealth-distribution-military-living-standards-leadership-level-of-advancement-technological-achievements-current-and-historical-contributions-to-the-world-etc

Answer: Cowboys did rough outdoor work at the edge of their civilization, but, as the other answers show, they were still part of that civilization. An urban Egyptian might have a roof over his head, food security, and civil order to count on, but his technical level was much lower than the cowboy’s. Living rough and living low-tech are unrelated things.
